Package org.securecryptoconfig

Interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SecureCryptoConfig
    public interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
    Interface defining methods that can be used to perform different cryptographic use cases. Most methods are defined inside SecureCryptoConfig. To start performing the desired use case make use of this class as starting point of your implementation.
    Author:
    Lisa

    • Method Detail

      • encryptSymmetric

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                                                              org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                                                       throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                              java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                              SCCException
        Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The encryption can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCCiphertext c = scc.encryptSymmetric(sccKey, plaintext);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
        Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be encrypted.
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric
        SCCException

      • encryptSymmetric

 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
        Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as byte[]
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException

      • encryptAsymmetric

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCCiphertext encryptAsymmetric​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                                                               org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                                                        throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                               java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                               SCCException
        Asymmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The encryption can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCCiphertext c = scc.encryptAsymmetric(sccKey, plaintext);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be encrypted.
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric
        SCCException

      • hash

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                                     throws COSE.CoseException,
                                            SCCException
        Hashing of a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCHash hash = scc.hash(plaintext);
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be hashed.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • updateHash

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash updateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext,
                                                  org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
                                           throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                  SCCException
        Given a SCCHash of a plaintext: the corresponding plaintext will be hashed again with the current Secure Crypto Config.

        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be hashed.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        hash - : SCCHash
        Returns:
        SCCHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

        Returns:

        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException

      • validateHash

        boolean validateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext,
                     org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
              throws COSE.CoseException,
                     SCCException
        Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.

        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be hashed.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        hash - : SCCHash
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • validateHash

        boolean validateHash​(byte[] plaintext,
                     org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
              throws COSE.CoseException,
                     SCCException
        Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as byte[]
        hash - : SCCHash
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • sign

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCSignature sign​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                                                 org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                                          throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                 java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                 SCCException
        Signing with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The signing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCSignature sig = scc.sign(sccKey, plaintext);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.Signing);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]): 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be signed.
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCSignature
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric
        SCCException

      • sign

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCSignature sign​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                                                 byte[] plaintext)
                                          throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                 java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                 SCCException

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.Signing);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as byte[]
        Returns:
        SCCSignature
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException

      • passwordHash

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface password)
                                                     throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                            SCCException
        Hash a password based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The password hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCPasswordHash hash = scc.passwordHash(password);
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the password to be hashed.
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCPasswordHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • passwordHash

        org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordHash​(byte[] password)
                                                     throws COSE.CoseException,
                                                            SCCException
        Hash a password based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The password hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCPasswordHash hash = scc.passwordHash(password);
        Parameters:
        password - : as byte[]
        Returns:
        SCCPasswordHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • validatePasswordHash

        boolean validatePasswordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface password,
                             org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordhash)
                      throws COSE.CoseException,
                             SCCException
        Validate a given SCCPasswordHash against given password. The password will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        passwordhash - : SCCPasswordHash
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException
